item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Data sleuths who spotted research misconduct cleared of defamation (154 points | 28 comments)
2. Learning to Reason with LLMs (1403 points | 1070 comments)
3. Breaking Down OnlyFans' Economics (35 points | 8 comments)
4. F3 – Fight Flash Fraud (35 points | 14 comments)

6. Imbue (Formerly Generally Intelligent) (YC S17) Is Hiring Software Engineers ( | hide)
7. FDA Authorizes First Over-the-Counter Hearing Aid Software (13 points | 1 comment)
8. The Strange Case of the Rogue HP-12c Calculator (19 points | 3 comments)
9. Notepat • Aesthetic Computer (7 points | discuss)
10. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (146 points | 82 comments)
11. Random access string compression with FSST and Rust (35 points | 1 comment)
12. Defusedxml – defusing XML bombs and other exploits (57 points | 13 comments)
13. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (214 points | 63 comments)
14. Why Haskell? (309 points | 402 comments)
15. If I could dissect a sauropod (105 points | 14 comments)
16. Show HN: Galaxy Visualization (46 points | 11 comments)
17. Jax and Equinox: What are they and why should I bother? (45 points | 5 comments)
18. DEF Con 32 – AMD Sinkclose Universal Ring-2 Privilege Escalation (Not Redacted) [pdf] (184 points | 29 comments)
19. Some pterosaurs would flap, others would soar (3 points | discuss)
20. Show HN: Goroutine Monitor Powered by eBPF (67 points | 2 comments)
21. Ask HN: Is a Masters in CS/Engineering worth it for a mid-career PM? (24 points | 36 comments)
22. Linear, symmetric, self-selecting 14-bit molecular memristors (2023) (94 points | 53 comments)
23. Ask HN: Should I open source my licensing server? (12 points | 13 comments)
24. Why is language documentation still so terrible? (36 points | 26 comments)
25. Peer Gynt quilt, Part 1 (2021) (61 points | 6 comments)
26. Qubit Transistors Reach Error Correction Benchmark (58 points | 18 comments)
27. 1913: When Hitler, Trotsky, Tito, Freud and Stalin all lived in the same place (177 points | 118 comments)
28. Show HN: Repogather – copy relevant files to clipboard for LLM coding workflows (47 points | 24 comments)
29. Greenland landslide caused freak wave that shook Earth for nine days (5 points | discuss)
30. Ergo: Erlang-inspired event driven actor framework in Go (145 points | 93 comments)
